means: 应急有效的，权宜之计的( expedient的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: He is full of [ fruitful in ] expedients .
Perhaps Calonne might return too, with fresh financial expedients.
sentence.Network_cn: 或许卡洛纳也会回来, 带有新的财政机谋.

sentence.Network_en: We made no strategic assessment, instead, we bandied technical expedients about.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们没有从战略上进行估计, 相反, 我们只在技术性的办法上转来转去.

list.abs: 佛教名称中英文对照_哲学家_新浪博客 ... expedient means 方便 expedient wisdom 权智 explain 说.
expectingly 期待地expedient rationality 方便的推理experience 经验
expanded polystyrene 泡沬塑料；发泡胶expedient connection 非法接驳排污渠；权宜的接驳渠道exploitation 开采
expediency =expedienceexpedient measure 简便措施expedient 便利的

entry.def: An expedient is an action that achieves a particular purpose, but may not be morally right.

example.ex: Surgical waiting lists were reduced by the simple expedient of striking off all patients awaiting varicose vein operations...
example.tran: 采取了将所有等待进行静脉曲张手术的病人从名单上删除的简单做法，这一权宜之计使得外科手术等待名单得以缩减。

example.ex: The story was a temporary expedient.
example.tran: 这个借口是临时的应急之法。

entry.tran: 有利的;方便的;权宜之计的
entry.def: If it is expedient to do something, it is useful or convenient to do it, even though it may not be morally right.

example.ex: Governments frequently ignore human rights abuses in other countries if it is politically expedient to do so.
example.tran: 如果在政治上对自己有利，各国政府经常忽视其他国家侵犯人权的行为。

auth_sentence.content: The time for baffling expedients and political waffling is over.
auth_sentence.res_content: The time for baffling expedients and political waffling is over.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The time for baffling expedients and political waffling is over.
